news_header: King Felipe VI and officials faced protests during a visit to flood-hit Valencia, where over 200 people died.
news_text: During a visit to Valencia, which has been devastated by floods resulting in over 200 deaths, King Felipe VI and Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez encountered a hostile crowd. The visit was cut short as protesters shouted insults and threw objects. The Spanish authorities have faced criticism for their slow response to the disaster, with many locals feeling abandoned. Recovery efforts are ongoing, with thousands of volunteers assisting in cleanup operations.
